channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Not sure exactly how big but it’s quite big and it’s very deep on Wellington Street SE18, just before the side road into Rectory place, 16th February
item.description:
Not sure how long it’s been there but the hole and deep enough that if you don’t avoid it you’re going to damage your tyre, it burst my tyre on Saturday the 14th of February

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Artillery Place, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking illegally with no dropped curb and mud all over pavement, 16th February
item.description:
Car is parking illegally with no dropped curb over the pavement in the way of the pedestrians causing danger to anyone walking and has created mud all over pavement which is preventing access for wheelchair users and also mums with buggies causing people to slip. Its extremely dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 257, Main Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Merchland Road, Eltham

item.title: Dog fouling on Northdown Road, 16th February
item.description:
Persistent dog fouling along Northdown Road running from Avondale Road right up to Gypsy Road … dog owners are not picking the dog poo up and very often more than one is left on pavement near our house /driveway … I reported this over 18 mo the ago but nobody responded to say that stencils would be applied .. please could Bexley Council address this problem ? Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northdown Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On going since October 2025, 16th February
item.description:
In October 2025 the lamppost outside my house 510 footscray road was knocked down by a car , for weeks nothing was done , we complained and shortly after a new lamp post was erected, but the old damaged one was left in place , engineer showed up weeks later to connect the new one but it was 3 feet from the original now smashed one which was still in place but the wiring hadn't been channeled over, we complained for a 3rd time and they showed up took out the damaged one and channeled the wiring to the new one , that was a month ago , the engineer hasn't come back to complete the connection so the lamp post is still not working , since early October last year ?? Can we get it connected, the bend outside has always had car crash issues and this is making it alot worse. Ron Mulock 510 footscray road SE93UA ( we are Bexley borough )
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, County Gate, New Eltham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
